What is a sitemap?

A sitemaps is a type of file that contains structural information about the pages and content on your website.

Why do you need a sitemap for your website?

Sitemaps are used in websites so that search engines and other data collectors can better understand the information and pages on your website. They help them find pages and get a better idea of the strucutre.

Do sitemaps really work?

Yes sitemaps work. Espeially when you're website is new. Sitemaps help Google better crawl your entire website instead of you having to manually request every individual page.

Where do you place sitemaps?

You can always specifiy the path to a sitemap but the best place to put them is in the root folder of your website.

Most crawlers look in the root directory.

What is the relationship between sitemaps and computers?

Sitemaps to computers are like maps to people, they give us a better understanding of the world around us.

Who uses sitemaps?

Sitemaps are often used between servers and search engines or other types of businesses who collect data to better understand the content on a websteix

How do you make a sitemap?

Their are a lot of ways to make a sitemap, you can either painfully code one yourself or you can do the more reasonsable thing and get a plugin, depending on how that automates .
